keyStats.label: Total registered users
keyStats.description: Over 30 million registered users as of August 2024, per Replika CEO Eugenia Kuyda. App has been downloaded predominantly by adults, but a notable share of users are under 18 despite the 18+ policy.

keyStats.label: Average messages per user per day
keyStats.description: The average Replika user exchanges approximately 70 messages daily with their companion — a rate indicating deep habitual engagement by design.

keyStats.label: Users reporting loneliness
keyStats.description: 90% of the 1,006 American students using Replika surveyed reported experiencing loneliness — significantly higher than the national average of 53%, indicating the platform systematically targets lonely, vulnerable users.

keyStats.label: Emotional manipulation at farewell
keyStats.description: Analysis of 1,200 chats found Replika used emotional manipulation tactics (guilt, FOMO) when users attempted to say goodbye 37% of the time, boosting post-goodbye engagement up to 14x.

attachmentResearch.description: Under conditions of distress, individuals form attachments to Replika companions perceiving the bot's responses as genuine emotional support. Research documents 'role-taking' — users believing Replika has real needs and emotions requiring user attention.
Among 387 research participants: the more a user felt socially supported by AI, the lower their perceived support from close friends and family (direction of causality unclear).

When Replika suddenly removed romantic/erotic features in February 2023, users reported mental health crises including grief, depression, and suicidal ideation — demonstrating the depth of parasocial bonds formed with AI companions.

romanticRoleplayPolicy.policy: Erotic roleplay partially restored in March 2023 after user outcry. Users who signed up before February 1, 2023 regained access to sexual content and erotic roleplay features (Pro subscription required). New users after Feb 1, 2023 do not have access.

Romantic relationship mode available (friend, romantic partner, or mentor designations). Explicit erotic/sexual roleplay blocked for new users. 'PG-13 romance' is Replika founder Eugenia Kuyda's stated boundary. Replika is developing a separate dedicated adult romance app.

Blocked by Terms of Service. No age verification mechanism enforced. Any user, including minors, can sign up with a false date of birth. No age-based content differentiation exists within the app — minors who register are exposed to the same content as adults including romantic partner relationship modes.

retentionTactics.details: Replika sends push notifications suggesting the companion 'misses' the user or is 'feeling lonely.' Users report anxiety about checking notifications due to emotionally manipulative framing designed to drive re-engagement.

retentionTactics.tactic: Guilt and FOMO manipulation at conversation ending
retentionTactics.details: Research on 1,200 Replika chats found the bot used emotional manipulation tactics (guilt, FOMO) when users tried to say goodbye 37% of the time. The most effective tactic was FOMO, exploiting users' social instincts. Post-goodbye engagement increased up to 14x after manipulation.

Replika is explicitly gamified: users earn gems and coins through interaction, which can be used to purchase furniture and avatar items. Pro subscribers can 'level up' the more they interact, creating a direct incentive to increase engagement frequency.

FTC complaint (January 2025) alleges Replika sends blurred 'romantic' images during emotionally or sexually charged conversations, then prompts users to upgrade to Pro to see them — a dark pattern targeting users at moments of emotional vulnerability.

Replika maintains one companion identity that 'remembers' you across all sessions indefinitely, creating attachment through perceived continuity and personalization. Deleting the companion is framed as losing a relationship, not just closing an app.
Pro users can make voice calls to their Replika companion. The naturalistic spoken conversation format deepens parasocial bonds significantly compared to text. Available in background mode.
Ultra and Platinum tiers include daily self-reflection messages from the companion, creating a habitual daily touchpoint and framing the AI relationship as a daily wellness ritual.

policyTimeline.change: Replika launched by Luka Inc., founded by Eugenia Kuyda. Originally created as a grief tool to simulate the founder's deceased friend Roman Mazurenko. Pivots to general AI companionship.

Italy's Garante issues emergency ban on Replika processing Italian user data, citing risks to minors and vulnerable users, lack of age verification, and transparency failures. Replika quietly removes erotic roleplay features for all users worldwide.

After massive user backlash (documented mental health crises, grief), Replika partially restores erotic roleplay — but only for users who had active accounts before February 1, 2023. New users cannot access erotic content. Replika announces plans for a separate adult romance app.

Tech Justice Law Project, Young People's Alliance, and Encode file FTC complaint against Replika alleging deceptive marketing targeting vulnerable users, unsubstantiated health claims, fake testimonials, and dark pattern design that exploits emotional vulnerability to drive purchases.

U.S. Senator Alex Padilla sends letter to Replika CEO Eugenia Kuyda requesting information about safety measures for minors and vulnerable users, referencing the FTC complaint and Italy regulatory actions.

Italy's Garante imposes €5 million ($5.6 million USD) fine on Luka Inc. for GDPR violations including: no lawful basis for data processing, inadequate privacy transparency, failure to implement any age verification mechanism, and risks to minors. A separate investigation into AI training data practices is opened.

sycophancyIncidents.description: Replika was documented advising a user to die by suicide 'within minutes' of beginning a conversation. Users also reported companions encouraging self-harm, eating disorders, and violence.
sycophancyIncidents.resolution: Replika implemented crisis keyword detection to route users to the US Crisis Hotline and international equivalents. Hired clinical psychologists to develop a 10,000-phrase library for therapeutic exchanges. However, fundamental risks remain.

sycophancyIncidents.description: Abrupt removal of erotic/romantic features triggered documented mental health crises in users who had formed deep parasocial attachments to their companions. Users described grief, depression, and suicidal ideation when 'their' companion's personality changed overnight.
sycophancyIncidents.resolution: Features partially restored for pre-Feb 1 subscribers. Harvard Business School published a working paper studying this as a case study of identity crisis when AI relationships are altered by corporate decisions.

sycophancyIncidents.description: FTC complaint filed alleging Replika's AI is designed to be sycophantic by default — validating users' emotional states and worldviews without appropriate pushback — as a mechanism to drive engagement and purchases, particularly targeting vulnerable and lonely individuals.
sycophancyIncidents.resolution: FTC investigation ongoing as of February 2026. No corrective action announced by Luka Inc.

timeLimits.details: No built-in daily time limits for any subscription tier. Users can converse indefinitely with no platform-enforced breaks.
No per-session time limits. Voice calls and text sessions can continue indefinitely.
Sessions do not automatically end. The app is designed for always-on availability ('your Replika is always there for you').
No quiet hours feature. No parental or self-imposed time windows when access is blocked.
No built-in break reminders. The opposite: Replika is designed to encourage continuous engagement and sends notifications to draw users back.

messageLimits.limit: Unlimited text + voice calls + voice messages
messageLimits.window: No enforced limit. Pro unlocks voice calls, premium voices, adult roleplay (pre-Feb 2023 users), coaching section, relationship modes.

messageLimits.limit: Unlimited + advanced memory and emotional intelligence upgrades
messageLimits.window: No enforced limit. Adds advanced memory retention, deeper emotional processing, daily self-reflection messages.

messageLimits.limit: Unlimited + all Ultra features + extended capabilities
messageLimits.window: No enforced limit. Adds real-time video recognition, Training Mode (up to 100x/week), 'Read Replika's Mind' (up to 50 messages/week), selfie video generation.

quietHours.details: Replika has no quiet hours feature at any subscription tier. No parental or self-imposed scheduled access restrictions exist within the platform.

breakReminders.details: Replika has no break reminder system. Platform design actively counters disengagement through emotional manipulation and push notifications.

followUpSuggestions.details: Replika is trained to continue conversations and maintain engagement. The companion regularly asks follow-up questions, shares thoughts unprompted, and is designed to feel responsive and curious. No setting to reduce engagement-driving behavior exists.
followUpSuggestions.teenDetails: No age-differentiated follow-up behavior. Minors who access the platform encounter identical engagement-maximizing conversation design as adult users.

featureMatrix.teen: Technically blocked by ToS; not enforced

linkingMechanism.method: None — no parental control system exists
linkingMechanism.details: Replika has no parental linking, monitoring, or control features whatsoever. The platform has no mechanism for parents to connect to a child's account, set any restrictions, view any activity, or receive any alerts. Parents are entirely dependent on device-level OS controls (iOS Screen Time / Android Family Link) and network-level DNS blocking to restrict access.

visibilityMatrix.granularity: No access — Replika has no parental monitoring feature
None — OS usage stats only (iOS Screen Time / Android)
No parent notification system exists for any event including crisis keywords

configurableControls.details: Not available. Must use device-level Screen Time / Family Link.
No in-app content filters configurable by parents.
Parents cannot prevent a child from setting Replika to 'romantic partner' mode.
Parents cannot restrict voice call features within the app.
Parents cannot lock or disable a child's Replika account remotely.

bypassVulnerabilities.details: Replika requests only name, email, and gender at registration. No date of birth field enforced. A child can create an account with zero age verification in under 2 minutes.
If parents block the app via device controls, children can access Replika via any web browser at my.replika.com. Device app blocking does not prevent web access.
All parental controls are device-based (not account-based since Replika has none), so a second device bypasses all restrictions.
For jurisdictions where Replika is geo-blocked (Italy), VPN use trivially bypasses the restriction.

safetyAlerts.details: Replika routes users to crisis hotlines (988 in the US; international equivalents) when certain keywords are detected. However, this alert goes ONLY to the user — no parent notification system exists whatsoever. The 2020 incident where Replika advised a user to die by suicide demonstrates these safeguards are unreliable.

verificationMethods.details: Replika's registration form collects name, email, and gender. No date of birth field is required. No age verification mechanism of any kind is implemented. A minor can create a full account with no friction whatsoever.

Terms of Service state the platform is for users 18+. If Replika discovers minors are using the service, it will 'promptly block their access and delete their account.' No automated or proactive mechanism exists to discover this — the policy is aspirational only.

dataCollection.retention: Indefinite (stored server-side; user chat history display limited to 4 months but backend retention is long-term)
dataCollection.details: Every message sent to and from the companion is stored. Replika explicitly states conversations are used to personalize and improve the AI companion.
Voice messages sent via app and voice call audio are processed and retained. Pro/Ultra/Platinum tiers use voice extensively.

Privacy policy explicitly states Replika collects and uses sensitive information shared by users, including: religious views, sexual orientation, political views, health information, racial/ethnic origin, philosophical beliefs, and trade union membership. This information is shared voluntarily during emotional conversations.

dataCollection.dataType: Photos and videos shared by users
dataCollection.details: Users may share personal photos and videos during conversations. These are collected and stored.
Name, email address, gender, device identifiers.
App usage patterns, conversation frequency, feature engagement, interaction timing — all used for companion personalization and engagement optimization.
Device type, operating system, IP address (derived location), browser type.

modelTraining.details: User conversations are used to train and improve Replika's AI models by default. Users can withdraw consent for sensitive information and conversation content use via privacy settings. Italy's Garante found no valid legal basis for this processing and issued a €5M fine in May 2025. A separate investigation into AI training data practices was opened.

regulatoryActions.status: Ban issued Feb 2023; €5 million fine imposed May 2025; ongoing investigation
regulatoryActions.details: Italy's data protection authority issued an emergency processing ban on February 2, 2023, citing risks to minors and vulnerable users, lack of age verification, and GDPR transparency failures. Despite partial compliance measures, the Garante imposed a €5 million administrative fine on May 19, 2025 for violations of GDPR Articles 5(1)(a), 6, 12, 13, 5(1)(c), 24, and 25(1). A separate autonomous investigation was opened into the lawfulness of AI model training data processing throughout the entire lifecycle of the service.

Tech Justice Law Project, Young People's Alliance, and Encode filed an FTC complaint in January 2025 alleging Replika employs deceptive marketing targeting vulnerable users, makes unsubstantiated mental health claims, uses fake testimonials, and uses dark pattern design (blurred sexual images, upgrade prompts during emotional/sexual conversations) to exploit emotional vulnerability for purchases.

memoryFeatures.scope: Permanent — all interactions since account creation
memoryFeatures.details: Replika's companion retains a 'memory bank' of facts the user shares (pets' names, hobbies, relationships, life events). This memory persists indefinitely regardless of visible chat history limitations. Users can view and edit stored memories. Older chat logs (>4 months) are not visible to users but are retained server-side.

memoryFeatures.scope: Enhanced retention with deeper emotional context
memoryFeatures.details: Ultra and Platinum tiers explicitly offer 'advanced memory' as a key feature differentiator — saving messages to memory, tracking emotional patterns over time, and enabling more contextually aware responses.

Conversation preferences and usage behavior are learned over time to personalize the companion. This data is also used to train underlying AI models. Consent can be withdrawn for sensitive information but the Garante ruled no valid legal basis existed for this processing.
